channel.title: Compile
channel.description:
I have my variables set but i get this
[URL=http://img366.imageshack.us/i/2myrg4z.png/][IMG]http://img366.imageshack.us/img366/6442/2myrg4z.png[/img][/URL]
any help?

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @range_ftw101 range ftw101
item.description:
@range_ftw101 wrote:

ok, i had the same problem. go to java and download the newest JDK, once you download it , install it and whatever, then right click your compiler and click edit , then erase whats in there and put :

@echo off
title Jeff’s kick ass compiler!
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_19\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

then it should work, hope i could help!

Read full topic

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

try this

@echo off @TITLE Clawz Pkz Compiler :D if exist "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java" (call :compile "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You Havent Downloaded Java :P.... :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic

item.title: Compile
item.dc:creator: @damien_b damien b
item.description:
@damien_b wrote:

[quote=“Killea, post:3, topic:335178”]replace your compile.bat with this one:

@echo off @TITLE Clawz Pkz Compiler :D if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You Havent Downloaded Java :P.... :end echo Finished! pause exit[/quote]

still get the same error.

Read full topic
